definition[0]: to surprise someone by walking up behind them silently
example[0]: Don’t yell – let’s creep up on them and scare them.
definition[1]: if a feeling or idea creeps up on you, it gradually increases
example[1]: The feeling she had for Malcolm had crept up on her and taken her by surprise.
definition[2]: to seem to come sooner than you expect
example[2]: Somehow, the end of term had crept up on us.
